openSource.title: Open Source
openSource.description: LocaleDB est enti√®rement gratuit et open source. Vous pouvez utiliser ces donn√©es dans vos projets sans restrictions. Le code source et les donn√©es sont disponibles sur GitHub sous licence MIT.

hero.title: Global Data for Modern Apps
hero.subtitle: LocaleDB is a comprehensive, open-source database of localization data for developers building international applications. We aggregate and process data from authoritative sources including CLDR, ISO standards, and OpenFlights.

cta.title: Open Source & Community Driven
cta.description: LocaleDB is MIT licensed and welcomes contributions. Whether you're fixing a typo, adding a missing country, or improving the UI, we'd love your help.

contributing.title: Contribuer √† LocaleDB

hero.title: Contributing to LocaleDB
hero.subtitle: LocaleDB is an open-source project and we love contributions from developers worldwide!

fixData.title: Fix Data
fixData.description: Correct typos or update outdated locale information.

addCountry.title: Add Country
addCountry.description: Add missing countries using standard codes.

improveCode.title: Improve Code
improveCode.description: Enhance the UI, search, or build scripts.

step1.title: Fork & Setup
step1.description: Fork the <link>GitHub repository</link> and clone it to your local machine.

step2.title: Use Data Overrides
step2.description: To fix data, do not edit the generated files in /data/countries/. Instead, create or edit a file in /data/overrides/XX.json (where XX is the country code).

step3.title: Verify & Submit
step3.description: Run the build script to verify your changes are merged correctly. Then submit a Pull Request with references to official sources.

help.title: Need Help?
help.description: Have a question or stuck on a step? Start a discussion on GitHub.

footer.description: Donn√©es de localisation gratuites et open source pour les d√©veloppeurs.

search.ariaLabel: Rechercher des pays, devises et codes

roadmap.title: Project Roadmap
roadmap.subtitle: LocaleDB's development journey and future plans.

1.title: Project Initiation & Data Population
1.description: Initial setup of the Next.js project and population of core data for countries, currencies, and languages.

2.title: Bug Fixes & Contribution System
2.description: Resolving initial issues and establishing a robust workflow for community contributions via overrides.

3.title: Data Export Interface
3.description: A user interface allowing users to select specific countries and export their data in custom JSON formats.

4.title: npm Package & CLI Tool
4.description: A dedicated npm package and CLI tool for developers to download and integrate locale data directly into their projects.

5.title: Public API Launch
5.description: Development and deployment of a RESTful API to serve locale data dynamically.

updates.title: Updates & Changelog
updates.subtitle: Track all changes and improvements to LocaleDB

docs.title: Documentation
docs.subtitle: Tout ce que vous devez savoir sur les donn√©es, le pipeline et l'architecture de LocaleDB.

overview.title: Vue d'ensemble
overview.description: LocaleDB est une encyclop√©die de localisation compl√®te et open-source pour les d√©veloppeurs cr√©ant des applications internationales.

items.comprehensive: Donn√©es compl√®tes provenant de sources faisant autorit√© (CLDR, Banque Mondiale, mledoze, libphonenumber, OpenFlights)
items.static: G√©n√©ration statique - aucune base de donn√©es d'ex√©cution requise

items.i18n: 11 langues avec prise en charge RTL pour l'arabe

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.description: Clone the repository and start exploring locale data in minutes.

dataPipeline.title: Data Pipeline
dataPipeline.description: LocaleDB processes data from multiple authoritative sources through a multi-stage pipeline.

sources.title: External Sources
sources.description: CLDR, mledoze, World Bank, libphonenumber, OpenFlights (MWGG)

update.title: Download Raw Data
update.description: pnpm update:data downloads files to data/ subdirectories

rawData.title: Raw Data Files
rawData.description: JSON, CSV, and XML files stored in data/

build.title: Process & Merge
build.description: pnpm build:data merges sources with priority rules

generated.title: Generated JSON
generated.description: Individual country, language, and currency files

priority.title: Data Source Priority
priority.description: When multiple sources provide the same field, we use a consistent priority system:

dataSchemas.title: Data Schemas
dataSchemas.description: Detailed structure of country, language, and currency JSON files.

fields.basics: Name, capital, coordinates, continent, population, area, languages, flagEmoji
fields.codes: ISO 3166, BCP-47, FIFA, IOC, FIPS, and other international codes
fields.currency: Code, symbol, position, separators, decimal digits, pattern, example
fields.dateTime: Date/time formats (full, long, medium, short), first day of week, timezones
fields.numberFormat: Decimal/thousands separators, digit grouping, numbering system
fields.phone: Calling code, patterns, format rules, subscriber number lengths
fields.addressFormat: Format template, postal code regex and example
fields.locale: Writing direction, measurement system, temperature scale, paper size, driving side
fields.airports: Array of airports with IATA, ICAO, coordinates, timezone

fields.name: English name
fields.countries: Array of country codes where spoken

fields.name: Currency name
fields.countries: Array of country codes using this currency

tree.data: Generated JSON files and raw source data

scripts.title: Scripts Reference
scripts.description: Available commands for data management and development.

updateData.description: Download raw data from all external sources

buildData.description: Process raw data and generate JSON files

checkI18n.description: Check and auto-fill missing translation keys

contributing.title: Contributing Data
contributing.description: How to contribute corrections and improvements to LocaleDB.

steps.fork: Fork the GitHub repository and clone to your local machine
steps.edit: Edit source priority in build-data.ts or submit corrections to upstream sources
steps.translations: Add translations by editing messages/{lang}.json and running check-i18n
steps.pr: Submit a Pull Request with one change per PR and links to official sources

items.sources: Always link to official sources (CLDR, government sites, ISO standards)
items.test: Run pnpm build:data to verify your changes merge correctly

i18n.title: Internationalization
i18n.description: LocaleDB supports 11 languages with plans for more.

languages.title: Supported Languages
languages.list: English, Turkish, Chinese, Hindi, Spanish, French, Arabic, Bengali, Portuguese, Russian, Japanese

location.title: Translation Files
location.description: All translations are stored in messages/{lang}.json files

rtl.title: RTL Support
rtl.description: Full right-to-left support for Arabic (ar) and other RTL languages

steps.routing: Add the locale code to src/i18n/routing.ts
steps.verify: Run npx tsx scripts/check-i18n.ts to verify completeness
